name: Debt Dilemma
title: High Public Debt Burden
description: In 2023, Angola's public and publicly guaranteed debt service reached 13.84% of its GNI, indicating a significant financial burden on the country's economy.

name: Education Gap
title: Low Educational Attainment
description: As of 2021, only 0.13% of Angola's population aged 25+ had at least a Bachelor's degree, highlighting a significant gap in higher education.

name: Health Cost Crunch
title: High Out-of-Pocket Health Expenditure
description: In 2018, 35.53% of Angolans spent more than 10% of their income on healthcare, indicating a high financial burden on households.

name: Remittance Roadblock
title: High Cost of Sending Remittances
description: In 2021, the average transaction cost of sending remittances from Angola was 16.86%, one of the highest globally, affecting financial inflows.

name: Aid Dependency
title: Negative Aid Flow from Portugal
description: In 2022, Angola experienced a net negative bilateral aid flow of $52.73 million from Portugal, indicating a reduction in financial support.

name: Private Debt Pressure
title: High Private Creditor Debt
description: In 2023, Angola's debt to private creditors stood at $2.71 billion, reflecting a significant financial obligation.
